item.title: Dedi for easyrsc?
item.dc:creator: @Bladex0x Bladex0x
item.description:
@Bladex0x wrote:

[quote=“yong min, post:8, topic:275579”][quote author=Kozy link=topic=364050.msg2764090#msg2764090 date=1240700399]
Pork, you don’t have to purchase DDoS Protection. There are much “Cheaper” ways to do it, you just have to know how/figure out. And yeah, His server is kinda boring, who would really want to play an EasyRSC source, with no spaces in the names and such, and where all it is is “Editing”.

-Kozy
[/quote]

To be honest, the time it’s taken him to put up the 5/6 unedited servers and create forums and stuff for them, he could have actually looked through the files and learnt to code at least 1 good thing and added that to 1 server and then hosted.[/quote]i do look through the files i dont see how u think im supossed to know how to actually “code” by just looking through files…

Read full topic

item.title: Dedi for easyrsc?
item.dc:creator: @Kozy Kozy
item.description:
@Kozy wrote:

Are you serious? Do you know what a Dedi even is… 0,o?

A dedi is basicly a computer that is devoted to you. You login to it through Remote Desktop, and it’s a regular computer, with Windows Server/Linux. You can have it running just the “Server”, or you can have it doing tons of things. Ofcourse it’s possible to run EasyRSC, it would just be like running it on your home comp, but of course, Faster Internet, and more Ram/HD to use for the server.

-Kozy

Read full topic
